name: 1st_to_18th_century
text:
1st to 18th century
The following events took place in the 1st to 18th century (1 – 1800 AD):
Events

12th century
The Welsh prince Madoc allegedly settles and founds colonies of "white Indians" along the Mississippi River, including the Mandan tribe.
15th century
The Freemasons are first founded in Europe.
16th century
Rabelais creates the concept of the Church of Thelema in a satirical novel.
1542 – Juan Rodriguez Cabrillo is the first western explorer to reach Puget Sound.
c. 1572 – Puget Sound is renamed Nova Albion by Francis Drake in honor of Queen Elizabeth I.
17th century
1670 – The king of England grants the Hudson Bay Company its charter.
18th century
Unknown year – A new style of beaver hat is popularized in Europe.
1741 – Russian explorers Vitus Behring and Peter Cherikof explore Puget Sound.
Spanish explorer Gaspar de Portola discovers and names the Arroyo Seco canyon in southern California.
1776 – A new style of beaver hat is popularized in Europe.
1787 –
General James Wilkinson, commander of the United States Army, becomes a double agent for the Spanish crown.
The Moose Massacre of more than fifty animals occurs in Twin Peaks' salt marshes.
May – French trapper and pedophile Gaston Leroux dies next to a lot of moss near Owl Cave after being the first to write that moss always grows to the north.
1791 – Titanium is discovered.
1793 – Alexander MacKenzie is the first Caucasian to reach the Pacific Northwest.
1795 – Ivan Pritikoff concludes the Vladivostok Treaty with the Chinook tribe.
Births
1775 – Dominick Renault
Deaths
May 1787 – Gaston Leroux
